Usage#

Installation#

To use sc_intNMF first install it using pip:

(.venv) $ pip install sc_intNMF

log TF-IDF#

To perform log term-frequency inverse document frequency (TF-IDF) transform of a single cell omics experiment (i.e. cell-feature matrix) you can use the nmf_models.log_tf_idf() functions:

nmf_models.log_tf_idf(mat_in, scale=10000)#

Return a TF-IDF transformed matrix.

Parameters

  • mat_in (csr matrix type, or other sparse/dense matrices which can be coerced to csr format.) â€“ Positional (required) matrix to be TF-IDF transformed. Should be cell x feature.

  • scale (int) â€“ Optional number to scale values by.

Raises

nmf_models.InvalidMatType â€“ If the mat type is invalid

Returns

TF-IDF transformed matrix

Return type

csr matrix

The mat_in parameter should be either "scipy csr_matrix", "dense matrix or rank-2 ndarray D", or "another sparse matrix". Otherwise, nmf_models.log_tf_idf() will raise an exception.

exception nmf_models.InvalidMatType#

Raised if the mat is invalid.

Raised if matrix type is invalid

class nmf_models.intNMF(n_topics, epochs=200, init='random')#

Class to run int NMF on multiome data

>>> import nmf_models
>>> import numpy as np
>>> nmf_models.log_tf_idf(np.array([[]]))
<1x0 sparse matrix of type '<class 'numpy.float64'>'
        with 0 stored elements in Compressed Sparse Column format>
